description: Probably an alteration of sumptuous. First noted in 1836, and originally meant "picky, fastidious" or "stylish, splendid": for example, a 1864 dictionary of slang defines it as "nice, particular,  beautiful". In the sense of "delicious" â€“ from 1881.

adjectives.description: scrumptious (comparative more scrumptious, superlative most scrumptious)
